page.title: 16GREAT WESTWOOD ESTATE
page.content: The estate is owned by the Hon.Anthony Cayzer,a wealthy ship merchant,and covers 2-3000 acres.The Head Game- keeper has been a gamekeeper for 35 years,but has been on this estate for 21 years.At Model Farm he has three assistants to help him.One of the other farms on the estate was owned by ancestors of ex. US President Car- ter. The gamekeeper's job is to stop animals from killing pheasants and other gamebirds.They trap foxes in snares and kill about 100 foxes each Winter.If the fox skins are in good condition they are sold to make fur coats or sent to laboratories for research.500 pheasants are kept for shooting;the estate is a good place for shooting and has been visited by the late Duke of Windsor. There are fifteen shoots a year.
